metadata.title: USN-3064-1 -- GnuPG vulnerability
metadata.description: Felix DÃ¶rre and Vladimir Klebanov discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled mixing functions in the random number generator. An attacker able to obtain 4640 bits from the RNG can trivially predict the next 160 bits of output.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3064-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  gnupg-curl - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4 gnupg-udeb - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4 gpgv - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4 gnupg - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4 gpgv-udeb - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4 No subscription required
